I know firsthand what this passage means for the success of farmers ranchers producers & manufacturers who fiercely rely on trade. I urge @realDonaldTrump to quickly implement this agreement so hardworking Americans can start reaping the benefits from the certainty it ensures.

Today marks a crucial moment for our nation’s trading relationships with Mexico and Canada with the Senate’s passage of the USMCA and I am proud to have voted in favor of this critical trade agreement.
Proud to be at the White House for today's historic signing.   Watch live here: https://t.co/vyDxGK167k

Today I voted to pass the #USMCA out of the HELP Committee and move it one step closer to the Senate floor. We must now act swiftly to pass this crucial trade agreement for farmers ranchers producers and manufacturers - not only in Kansas but across the US Mexico and Canada.
This #TradeTuesday Matt Perrier from Dalebanks Angus explains how #USMCANow will benefit the beef industry. https://t.co/S3xSMA9jsu

While these furloughs @SpiritAero will affect a large part of the aerospace workforce in Wichita I know the community is prepared to assist in every way possible. Wichita is the Air Capital of the World and I am committed to making sure that does not change.

His gentle soul made him an amazing husband father son brother and friend. My staff and I feel such sadness for the Allen family. Chris moved to @SenFinance a few years ago but we felt like he never left our team. We feel fortunate that Chris was a part of all of our lives.

Franki and I are heartbroken by the passing of my former legislative assistant Chris Allen. Chris was beloved by everyone who had the privilege of meeting him. He had a brilliant mind a generosity of spirit and a passion for serving the country in the United States Senate. https://t.co/ah9QjsK2x3

I am relieved no American or Iraqi lives were lost in last night’s attacks. As always my prayers are with our servicemen and women. Semper Fi.

I am glad President Trump is sending a very strong message to Iranian leaders. I believe it’s equally as important that President Trump very clearly left the door open for further negotiations that could lead to more peaceful relations.

I am proud to congratulate my dear friend Chuck Stones on his presidential nomination to the @FarmerMacNews board. I hope the Senate is able to move quickly through the confirmation process.  I have no doubt Chuck will make Kansas proud!

News Release: Senator Roberts: American Farmers and Ranchers Don’t Need #GreenNewDeal to Be Green  https://t.co/jL0f9jBdmy
In hampering American agriculture the #GreenNewDeal does not match up with these moral responsibilities.

I realize there are those who think the GND is a moral imperative.  But farmers continuing to feed the world is also a moral imperative.  Too many go hungry each day in America ending this is also a moral imperative.

These policy discussions must recognize the complexity of the agriculture and food value chain—growers input suppliers processors handlers and consumers.  And they must be based in reality to facilitate a genuine conversation between rural and urban constituencies.

Consumers will assuredly continue to demand the choice of animal protein here in the U.S. and so any reasonable discussion on the agriculture sector’s contributions to solutions on climate change must begin with this acknowledgment.

Regulating American farmers and ranchers out of business will only result in food and fiber production being outsourced to countries that do not have the same conservation-minded producers that we have here in the U.S.
Over the last 50 years American farmers have reduced water use in pork production by 41%.
American farmers and ranchers raise the same amount of beef today as they did in the 1970s but they do so with 33% fewer cattle.

Obviously we cannot and do not produce food in the same manner our grandparents did because those methods were not sustainable and today would not produce food at the scope and scale our troubled and hungry world demands.

American farmers ranchers and others in rural America are constantly working to produce their crops and to raise their livestock in order to feed a growing world and do so with constant challenges presented to them from Mother Nature.

The @FoundationFAR leverages public and private dollars to bring together experts to identify and investigate the researchable questions whose answers have the potential to enhance the economic and environmental resilience of our food supply.
I do not question the intent of the authors of the #GreenNewDeal but they don’t know what they don’t know. They need to catch up with the Agriculture committee and with farm country.
within agriculture there is nothing “New” with the #GreenNewDeal

To Supporters of the #GreenNewDeal: The men & women who make their living off the land have an imperative & keen interest in responsible use of natural resources. Show me a farmer who does not practice conservation or does not use latest tech & I will show you a farmer in trouble
I will be heading to the Senate floor shortly to talk about the Green New Deal. Watch live here: https://t.co/Vc0YEQqD5m
